dc_title_s: Tree Removal in Last 30 Days: Washington D.C.
dc_description_s: This data layer shows 311 Service Requests in the last 30 days for?requests of the removal of a dead or badly damaged tree from public space. ?DDOT's Urban Forestry Administration (UFA) removes trees that are dead, dying/diseased, or unsafe (those that have structural and/or dangerous root defects which cannot be corrected). Once a tree is inspected by an arborist, the arborist will determine what measures should be taken in regard to the tree in question.?In the event of an emergency, such as broken or hanging limbs, or a tree is down blocking the flow of traffic or obscuring the view of a stop sign or other traffic sign, the DDOT's Urban Forestry Division will respond to mitigate the issue.
